body:
I think that it's probably safer not to - backporting this could result in urls that previously worked not working after an update and if it's not caught in the app's tests then it could break in production. Since there's a workaround to get it to work as well then it's better to be on the safe side.

This caution is due to personal experience - once I broke someone's app in production when I backported a fix in how nested resource route names were generated. The name generated was so wrong I thought it was impossible that anyone could be using it but that assumption turned out to be wrong so I never assume anything now.
